entry.title: Edward Mosberg (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Holocaust survivor Edward Mosberg (pictured in his concentration camp uniform) was awarded the Commander's Cross of the Order of Merit of the Republic of Poland for his efforts recognizing the Polish war-time rescue of Jews?

entry.title: Look at the world (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that "Look at the world" is a 1996 choral harvest anthem with text and music by John Rutter, written for CPRE "on the theme of the environment and our responsibility towards it"?

entry.title: Greta Hofer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that although Austrian model Greta Hofer was only discovered in 2020, she was chosen to work exclusively for Prada that year?

entry.title: Canal station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a "frustration walk" connected Chicago Union Station with the rapid transit Canal station?

entry.title: Avar Wars (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during the Avar Wars, disease killed 90 per cent of Charlemagne's horses?

entry.title: Ethel Hampson Brewster (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1919 Ethel Hampson Brewster compared dropping ancient history from school curricula to "knock[ing] out the first two stories of a skyscraper"?

entry.title: a personal letter sent to Hitler (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the United States severed diplomatic ties with Finland in 1944 because of a personal letter sent to Hitler?

entry.title: Rockstar Lincoln (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Rockstar Lincoln used to keep live tarantulas at its offices?
